data.title: Files with .lang.example suffix should be treated as .lang
data.body:
If I have a file `config.toml.sample`, it should be treated as a `.toml` file in terms of syntax highlighting, linting, etc. Similar suffixes I've seen in the wild:
- `.sample`
- `.example`

data.title: Decorations on soft-wrap borders should not stretch across the border
data.body:
I don't think that the spell-check package is doing anything wrong here, so I assume that this visual bug is due to decorations stretching across soft-wrap boundaries when maybe they shouldn't:

![screen shot 2015-01-04 at 10 17 03 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1038121/5606912/de32d7fc-93fa-11e4-985e-02304d21b02b.png)

_(As a side note, I'm impressed that supercalifragilisticexpialidocious is in the OS X dictionary. I had to come up with another long nonsense word :laughing:)_

I would expect that "absafragginglutely" would be decorated, but _not_ the space between "absafragginglutely" and the previous instance of the word "testing".

Atom v0.166.0-25b44ce on Mac OS X 10.10.1

/cc @benogle

behavior: input any char doesn't popup IME
thanks for reply :)

data.title: haml & slim support
data.body: `HAML` & `SLIM` are ruby on rails markdown languages. Will atom editor support (markdown) it? Where can I commit to support this functionality?

data.title: Replacing ^ and $ broken with "only in selection"
data.body:
In search and replace, enable the _Use Regex_ and _Only In Selection_ buttons and replace ^ or $ by any string. I expect the string to be prepended or appended to all selected lines.

In most combinations of selection (dragging down, up, starting or ending at a start or end of the line or not...) it leads to unexpected results, such as the replacement string being prepended/appended to somewhere before or after the selection, to all lines but the last one, to the beginning of the file or nothing at all.

It works as expected when _Only In Selection_ is disabled.

data.title: Single line comments are not always displayed correctly (JS file)
data.body:
## Problem When you have long lines in a JS file with single line comments at their end strange things happen. The issues happen to me twice today but only in specific cases (each time I was coding a concatenation of variables and strings) so I put examples that only need to be copy and paste. ## Configuration Atom version 0.165.0 Mac OS X version 10.10.2. File in JS language and encoded in UTF-8. ## Examples #### 1) Second line commented ``` javascript $("#answer-" + (maxAnswers + 1)).html("

" + term.substring(0, wordPos) + "" + term.substr(wordPos, this.help.val().length) + "" + "test".substring(this.help.val().length) + "

"); // Put the answer in the appropriate div. $("#answer-" + (maxAnswers + 1)).html("

" + term.substring(0, wordPos) + "" + term.substr(wordPos, this.help.val().length) + "" + "test".substring(this.help.val().length) + "

" ); // Put the answer in the appropriate div. ``` This code in Atom will put the second line in comment: ![capture d ecran 2015-01-03 a 21 26 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2117580/5603634/472a9428-938f-11e4-9ad8-119883c9760a.png) The second line has only one comment at its end but the entire looks commented. If you run this code the second line will be executed as it should. #### 2) No comment ``` javascript $("#answer-" + (maxAnswers + 1)).html("

" + term.substring(0, wordPos) + "" + term.substr(wordPos, this.help.val().length) + "" + term.substring(wordPos + this.help.val().length) + "

" + result); // Put the answer in the appropriate div ``` The comment is not correctly displayed: ![capture d ecran 2015-01-03 a 21 37 18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2117580/5603657/ba8c720a-9390-11e4-9bc0-87f27c3b7ca3.png)

data.title: Add priority recommendation for variable-sized panels
data.body:
Applies to #4834 

I figured this was a good piece of advice for package authors that create panel UI. I believe this is the best place to put this documentation. If it should go somewhere else, let me know.

/cc @benogle @maxbrunsfeld

data.title: Show zoom level (in status bar?)
data.body:
I wasn't sure the best place to put this (maybe [status-bar?](https://github.com/atom/status-bar)), but it would be nice to be able to see the zoom level somewhere in the UI. Since it's possible to zoom using `Cmd + -` / `Cmd + =`, it's possible to not realize the editor is zoomed because there's no way of telling.

It might also be cool to have some kind of visual feedback when you do zoom - maybe some kind of modal alert that pops up saying "Zoom: 125%" (for example) and fades away.

data.title: Make Find UI position lockable
data.body:
The Find UI is a bar across the bottom of the editor.  I also have a linter which places a bar across the bottom.  Depending on what line the cursor is on, the linter output will contain 0+ lines, so the linter bar height varies depending on the line.

When I search for a term, I click the 'Find' button.  The cursor moves to the next found instance, and the linter height changes, moving the 'Find' button away from my mouse cursor.  In effect, I have to look down at the mouse cursor and point it at the 'Find' button every time I want to find the next instance of the search term.  

It is common to browse code looking for instances of a search term, and this seems like a simple fix to make usable.  An option to affix the Find bar at the very bottom would do the trick.

data.title: The workbench should remember the recently opened project
data.body: Currently, if I close the editor and open it again, I have to go through the same steps to open the project again. Why not to remember the previously opened project and open it automatically once the user starts the editor?

data.title: Command Palette not working at all
data.body:
I've seen some issues on here about the command palette key binding not working, but I'm having an issue where the command palette won't show up even if I select it from the tool bar. So this is not an issue with the key binding.

Windows 8.1

data.title: Updated documentation concerning FreeBSD
data.body:
Added information concerning bash and setting CC and CXX on FreebSD to docs/build-instructions/freebsd.md
Added 'Highly Experimental' sub-bullet to README.md underneath FreeBSD

data.title: Drag tab out of window to open in new window
data.body:
It would be nice to be able to drag a tab out of the window and have it open in a new window rather then having to open a new window then drag the tab into the new window.

I'm on Windows 8.1, not sure if this behavior is different on other OS.

data.title: Different styling for different lines, how to separate odd and even lines?

data.title: Respect options to Cursor::getBeginningOfNextWordBufferPosition
data.body: The `wordRegex` option wasn't respected.

data.title: Atom doesn't start (AwesomeWM, Arch linux)
data.body:
Hello,

please help me, I am not sure if it is a bug or I don't know how to use something.

I use Arch Linux and AwesomeWM, I installed Atom 0.165 from AUR.
When I click on some file in some file manager and select "Open with..." and then Atom, Atom starts fine and opens the selected file, but when I want to start Atom on its own with the Mod4+R run command "atom" in AwesomeWM, I only get spinning wheel cursor for a few seconds and nothing happens, when I write "atom ~/test" for example, where "test" is a text file, Atom starts fine.

Thanks..

data.title: Want API for changing the cursor blink rate
data.body: I don't see any documentation for this, so maybe it's my fault, but I would like an API for changing the cursor blink speed. It's faster than most other apps on OS X, and the inconsistency squicks my CDO. I definitely don't need or want it changed in the base app, but would like the ability to make a package for it. I am aware of [ease-blink](https://atom.io/packages/ease-blink) but I don't see the API it uses in the documentation, and the search isn't finding it. I will freely admit that I am brand new to Atom and thus am probably missing something; pointers to the manual would be greatly appreciated, if that's what I'm missing!

data.title: Unfocused Password For Protected Files
data.body: When saving a protected file, such as http-vhosts.conf, Atom displays an authentication dialog. But the password field is unfocused requiring the user to click on the dialog and the field. It would be much more convenient of Atom would focus on that password field automatically.

### Atom Version: Version 0.165.0 (0.165.0)
### Dev Screenshot

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1703729/5591594/dacd622a-913a-11e4-985b-477b92fd56fe.png)

data.title: who is putting a shadow dom on my checkbox?
data.body: My input checkboxes all have a shadow DOM attached.  When I add `checked="checked"` to them nothing happens.  What code is doing this and how do I disable it?

data.title: Uncaught Error: Can't undo with an open transaction
data.body:
Uncaught Error: Can't undo with an open transaction

**Atom Version**: 0.161.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.1
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Steps To Reproduce
1. Type
2. Press Cmd+Z
### Stack Trace


data.title: Highlighting styling not being applied
data.body:
When highlighting text with cursor, the highlighted text does not have any styling being applied to it. The line numbers do however change color. 

**OS:** Ubuntu 14.04
**Atom:** 0.166.0-5276cb7
**UI:** Atom Dark v0.42.0
**Syntax:** Atom Dark v0.23.0
